title: Vue $slots Object

metadata.description: Learn about Vue $slots Object with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Vue Component Instance Reference

Example
Using the
$slots
object to check if the parent has provided content for the 'topSlot'.
mounted(){
  if(this.$slots.topSlot){
    this.slotsText = "Content for the 'topSlot' slot is provided by the parent."
  }
  else {
    this.slotsText = "Content for the 'topSlot' slot is NOT provided by the parent."
  }
}
Run Example »
Definition and Usage
The
$slots
object represents the slots passed from the parent.
Slots passed from the parent can be seen by calling
this.$slots
, or by calling
this.$slots.topSlot
to see a specific slot named 'topSlot'.
The
$slots
object can be used to check if slots are provided by the parent component, like in the example above, or to write render functions.

related_topics.title: C Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is slot?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of slot is 'provided by the parent'.

quiz.question: What is slot?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of slot is 'NOT provided by the parent'.

summary: This tutorial covers Vue $slots Object concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Vue $slots Object effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Vue $slots Object and how to apply it in your projects.
